intro: Planchonella eerwah, commonly known as the Eerwah plum, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the rainforests of New Guinea. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and fragrant white flowers. The tree produces small, round fruits that are typically yellow or orange when mature, containing a single seed surrounded by a juicy, acidic pulp. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland and hill forest areas. Due to its ornamental value and edible fruits, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and for local use.
